decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the end of three years from the date of this permission. Reason: To comply with the provisions of S.51 of the Planning & Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: 202478.1201, 202478.1301, 202478.1101, 202478.1302, 202478.1102, 202478.1001, 202478.1002Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

The external finishing materials shall match those used in the construction detailed within the approved drawings / application form. Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area.

No development shall take place until detailed drawings of the proposed new window and door, including sections and elevations at a scale between 1:20 and 1:1 as appropriate, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. These drawings shall include associated features such as lintels, cills, and material specifications. The works shall thereafter be carried out in full accordance with the approved details and permanently maintained as such.Reasons: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the listed building and the wider conservation area.

Notwithstanding the approved drawings, prior to their installation, details of all rainwater goods—including their material, colour, locations, profiles, dimensions, and decorative features (if applicable)—shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The rainwater goods shall be installed in full accordance with the approved details and thereafter permanently maintained as such.Reasons: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the listed building and the wider conservation area.
application_type_full: Householder planning & demolition in a conservation area
description: Single storey rear/side extension, with small removal of a section to short wall under rear sidelight window and minor removal of internal partition wall- not historic.
